wikipedia_page.main: Marianne Croker (1791–1854) was an English watercolour painter and author of the 19th century.

response: His c. 1837 self-portrait is in the National Portrait Gallery. He is known as the Father of water colour painting and also as an early pioneer of lithography, and was much admired by Turner. In October 2012 Pickering and district Civic Society erected a Blue Plaque in his memory on 3 Hungate Pickering. His daughter Marianne Croker was an artist, poet and author, and married Thomas Crofton Croker.
He was the only child of Thomas Crofton Croker, and Marianne Croker; his parents collaborated closely, and the son revised and edited some of their works.
